meanings.sent1: The volcano was spewing hot lava into the air.
meanings.sent2: The broken pipe was spewing water all over the floor.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing fountain was spewing water like a geyser.
meanings.sent4: The angry protester was spewing harsh words at the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The machine malfunctioned, spewing sparks everywhere.

meanings.sent1: After eating too much, he ended up spewing his dinner.
meanings.sent2: The sick child was spewing in the bathroom.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster made her feel like spewing her lunch.
meanings.sent4: The cat was spewing hairballs all over the carpet.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the garbage made him feel like spewing.

meanings.definition: To express strong emotions or opinions in a forceful manner
meanings.sent1: During the argument, she was spewing hurtful words.
meanings.sent2: The politician was spewing promises during the speech.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was spewing jokes that had the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was spewing facts during the lecture.
meanings.sent5: The radio host was spewing conspiracy theories on air.
